content.description: This is a fun traverse using the ledges and cracks of all of the routes.
content.protection: A crashpad and someone to move it as you traverse.
content.location: It combines all the routes starting on the rightmost edge of F-16, working right to left until on the face of Aerial Ace, where you can climb up and over the peak of the boulder.

content.description: Just to the right of Hand Jam Sandwich are some good holds, and the route follows a similar path but just uses better holds.
content.location: It is to the right of Hand Jam Sandwich.

content.description: This is a really solid finger crack that you can dig your fingers into and get a good twist. Pull up on the crack and stand. Some shallow underclings let you pull your feet up and top out.
content.protection: A pad, especially in the summer when the prickers are bad.
content.location: It is just on the right side of the H+J face, which faces south.

content.description: Climb the only overhang of the boulder up and over the shelf above. A certain heel hooks makes the awkward start crux more comfortable.
content.protection: A crashpad and maybe a spotter, so you don't fall into the thorny bushes.
content.location: This is the only overhanging face of the boulder that's encroached on by the bushes. Sit start, and scrounge for the small footholds to begin.

content.description: Boeing is an easy, warm-up problem climbing the arete.
content.location: On the face of the rock directly to the left of Aerial Ace, start low on the undercling, and climb directly up to the peak of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the black spray-painted face using the crimps and lower crack (holds highlighted in red) directly up to top out on the boulders peak. Sit start using the footholds highlighted in blue and the undercling holds (the first two red highlights).
content.protection: A crashpad. The descent is easy around the back of the boulder.
content.location: The path leads you directly to this route. Look for the black spray paint.

content.description: Area 69 is an exposed boulder on top of Pine Hill overlooking the runways at the Air Force Base with 2-3 routes on it.
